statements: SELECT * FROM Theater_Finances;
SELECT show_name, revenue FROM Theater_Finances WHERE show_date > '2022-01-01';
SELECT * FROM Theater_Finances WHERE revenue > 1000 AND expenses < 500;
SELECT show_name, revenue, expenses FROM Theater_Finances WHERE revenue > expenses ORDER BY revenue DESC;
SELECT show_id, show_name, show_date, (revenue - expenses) AS profit FROM Theater_Finances;
SELECT show_name, revenue FROM Theater_Finances WHERE show_date >= '2022-01-01' ORDER BY revenue DESC LIMIT 10
SELECT * FROM Theater_Finances WHERE expenses > revenue ORDER BY show_date ASC LIMIT 5
SELECT show_name, expenses FROM Theater_Finances WHERE show_date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-12-31' ORDER BY expenses DESC
SELECT show_id, show_name, revenue, expenses FROM Theater_Finances WHERE revenue > 10000 AND expenses < 5000 ORDER BY show_id DESC
SELECT show_name, expenses FROM Theater_Finances WHERE show_date < '2022-06-01' AND revenue BETWEEN 5000 AND 10000 ORDER BY show_date ASC LIMIT 3
SELECT * FROM shows ORDER BY show_date DESC;
SELECT show_name, revenue FROM shows WHERE revenue > 5000;
SELECT show_name, show_date, revenue FROM shows WHERE show_id = 3;
SELECT * FROM shows WHERE revenue > expense;
SELECT show_name, sum(revenue) as total_revenue FROM shows GROUP BY show_name;
SELECT * FROM shows WHERE show_date > '2022-01-01' ORDER BY revenue DESC LIMIT 10
SELECT show_name, show_date, revenue FROM shows WHERE expense < 5000 ORDER BY show_date
SELECT show_name, total_revenue - total_expense AS net_profit FROM financial_reports WHERE report_date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-12-31'
SELECT show_name, total_revenue, profit FROM shows INNER JOIN financial_reports ON shows.show_id = financial_reports.show_id WHERE profit > 0 ORDER BY profit DESC
SELECT COUNT(*) AS total_shows, AVG(revenue) AS avg_revenue FROM shows WHERE show_date BETWEEN '2021-01-01' AND '2021-12-31'
SELECT * FROM show_revenues ORDER BY show_name DESC;
SELECT revenue, show_name FROM show_revenues WHERE revenue > 5000;
SELECT show_id, SUM(revenue) AS total_revenue FROM show_revenues GROUP BY show_id HAVING total_revenue > 10000;
SELECT * FROM show_expenses WHERE expense_amount < 500;

SELECT show_name, revenue-expenses AS net_profit FROM financial_analysis JOIN show_revenues ON financial_analysis.show_id = show_revenues.show_id JOIN show_expenses ON financial_analysis.show_id = show_expenses.show_id;
SELECT * FROM show_revenues;
SELECT show_name, revenue FROM show_revenues ORDER BY revenue DESC;
SELECT show_name, revenue, expense_category, expense_amount FROM show_revenues r JOIN show_expenses e ON r.show_id = e.show_id;
SELECT r.show_name, r.revenue, e.expense_category, e.expense_amount FROM show_revenues r JOIN show_expenses e ON r.show_id = e.show_id WHERE e.expense_amount > 500;

SELECT r.show_name, sum(e.expense_amount) AS total_expenses, sum(r.revenue) AS total_revenue, sum(r.revenue) - sum(e.expense_amount) AS net_profit FROM show_revenues r JOIN show_expenses e ON r.show_id = e.show_id GROUP BY r.show_name;
SELECT show_name, show_date FROM Show;
SELECT * FROM Ticket WHERE ticket_price > 50;
SELECT employee_name, position FROM Employee ORDER BY position;
SELECT category_name, total_expense FROM ExpenseCategory WHERE total_expense < 1000;
SELECT revenue - expense AS profit FROM Show;
SELECT * FROM Show ORDER BY show_date DESC, revenue ASC LIMIT 10;
SELECT show_name, revenue FROM Show WHERE expense > 5000 ORDER BY revenue DESC;
SELECT e.employee_name, e.position, s.show_name FROM Employee e JOIN Show s ON e.employee_id = s.show_id WHERE e.salary > 60000;
SELECT category_name, total_expense FROM ExpenseCategory WHERE total_expense BETWEEN 1000 AND 5000 ORDER BY category_name;
SELECT t.ticket_id, t.ticket_price, s.show_date FROM Ticket t JOIN Show s ON t.show_id = s.show_id WHERE s.revenue > s.expense;
SELECT * FROM Show;
SELECT show_name, show_date FROM Show WHERE show_date >= '2022-01-01';
SELECT show_name, total_revenue FROM Show WHERE total_revenue > 10000;
SELECT * FROM Ticket WHERE ticket_price BETWEEN 50 AND 100 ORDER BY total_revenue DESC;
SELECT revenue_source, revenue_amount FROM Revenue WHERE revenue_source = 'Tickets';
SELECT * FROM Show;
SELECT show_name, total_revenue FROM Show WHERE show_date >= '2022-01-01';
SELECT * FROM Ticket ORDER BY quantity_sold DESC, ticket_price ASC;
SELECT revenue_source, SUM(revenue_amount) AS total_revenue FROM Revenue GROUP BY revenue_source ORDER BY total_revenue DESC;
SELECT show_id, budget_type, budget_amount FROM Budget WHERE budget_amount > 1000;
